It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically arranged in spikelets, a common feature among grass family members. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
